qas.question: What Kalingan ruler brought the Chedi dynasty back into power?
What power had previously defeated the Kalingans?
In what arena was Kalinga a formidable power?
What maritime advantage did the Kalingans have?
What militaristic leader restored might to the Kalinga empire?

context: During the reign of <a0_0>Khārabēḷa<a0_0/>, the Chedi dynasty of Kaḷinga ascended to eminence and restored the lost power and glory of Kaḷinga, which had been subdued since the devastating war with <a1_0>Ashoka<a1_0/>. Kaḷingan military might was reinstated by <a4_0>Khārabēḷa<a4_0/>: under Khārabēḷa's generalship, the Kaḷinga state had a formidable <a2_0>maritime<a2_0/> reach with <a3_0>trade routes<a3_0/> linking it to the then-Simhala (Sri Lanka), Burma (Myanmar), Siam (Thailand), Vietnam, Kamboja (Cambodia), Malaysia, Borneo, Bali, Samudra (Sumatra) and Jabadwipa (Java). Khārabēḷa led many successful campaigns against the states of Magadha, Anga, Satavahanas till the southern most regions of Pandyan Empire (modern Tamil Nadu).
